quote: Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?
Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.
A great restaurant doesn't distinguish itself by how few mistakes it makes but by how well they handle those mistakes.

You shouldn't say 'animals' to distinguish between humans and non-humans. We are all animals.

It's very difficult to distinguish between what a person believes and what they say they believe.
I distinguish sentiment from sentimentality. Sentimentality makes your skin crawl. It's like too much sugar. But, sentiment is a great feeling.

Education... has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.

I distinguish, between nationalism and patriotism.

Taste, which enables us to distinguish all that has a flavor from that which is insipid.

I simply do not distinguish between work and play.

We have within us, from the start, that which will distinguish us from the vulgar herd.

Although I'm deaf in only my left ear, when there is noise all around, I'm unable to distinguish sounds and can't hear anything.

Many conditions can lead to a false positive result, including flu shots, hepatitis, and pregnancy.

Put yourself in the position of an up-and-coming artist living in early-sixteenth-century Italy. Now imagine trying to distinguish yourself from the other artists living in your town: Michelangelo, Raphael, Leonardo, or Titian. Is it any wonder that the Italian High Renaissance lasted only 30 years?

He must tell the world the Panopticon has arrived. His masters vow to punish him, and he heads for Moscow in a desperate search for refuge.

They have cameras that distinguish ingredients one from each other and that tell you that shouldn't mix this ingredient with another ingredient.
